title: Aaron Kwok’s I’m Livin’ It to close London East Asia Film Festival 2019
text:
Kwok’s new film will close the festival (Picture: studioEAST/Getty Images)

The new film from celebrated actor Aaron Kwok will close the London East Asia Film Festival.

Last month, the official programme for LEAFF 2019 was announced, with this year’s Actor Focus celebrating Kwok and his career.

And as an added bonus, fans will get to see the European premiere of his latest project I’m Livin’ It, which will close the festival on 3 November.

The Hing Fan Wong directed film sees Kwok play a man who was once a star in his finance firm, but now spends his nights in a 24-hour fast food restaurant.

Kwok’s character encounters others in a similar rut, and strive to lift each other out of rock bottom.

Aaron Kwok is the subject of this year’s Actor Focus

Kwok himself will attend the closing gala in London for a Q&A, as well as attending the Actor Focus strand which will be celebrating his work with screenings of Port Of Call, Cold War and After This Our Exile.

The 53-year-old is one of Hong Kong’s most acclaimed actors, having starred in more than 60 films since his debut in 1984.

In its fourth year, LEAFF, headed by Festival Director Hyejung Jeon, will immerse film fans in East Asian culture by screening films from all genres across London, with titles chosen from South Korea, North Korea, China, Japan, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Singapore, Indonesia, Thailand, Phillipines and Malaysia.

This year, the theme of LEAFF is ‘crisis, chaos and survival’ – and will kick off with Exit, a new disaster action comedy from Korean director Lee Sang-geun.

Exit will open LEAFF 2019

The film follows Yong Nam, who uses his rock climbing skills to get everyone – including his crush Eui Ju – to safety as a mysterious white gas covers an entire district in Seoul.

Exit will open LEAFF on 24 October with its European premiere at Odeon Leicester Square.

LEAFF will be screening over 60 films from 10 different strands, celebrating Kwok, stories of women, 100 years of K-cinema, North Korean cinema, horror, samurai season, documentaries, and film and art.

This year’s Official Selection includes To The Ends of The Earth (Japan), A Girl Missing (Japan), The Wild Goose Lake (China), Three Husbands (Hong Kong), The Pool (Thailand), Cities of Last Things (Taiwan), Nina Wu (Taiwan), Long Live The King (Korea), Rainbow’s Sunset (Phillipines), Europe Raiders (China, Hong Kong), Balloon (China) and The Science Of Fictions (Indonesia, Malaysia).

In competition this year will be Money (Korea), Ms Purple (Korea), Send Me To The Clouds (China), Another Child (Korea), Deep Evil (Taiwan), G Affairs (Hong Kong), Still Human (Hong Kong), Summer of Changsha (China) and Wet Season (Singapore).

London East Asia Film Festival runs from 24 October until 3 November – for more info and tickets, visit their website.
